question: Will Apple stock continuously remain above $200 through March 31, 2025?
description: CNBC: [Apple has worst day since August following reports of China, AI struggles](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/01/16/apple-has-worst-day-since-august-down-11percent-from-december-peak.html)
fine_print: In case of forward or reverse stock splits, the price will be adjusted and resolved accordingly, based on comparison to the all-time high.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Prediction: Warren Buffett and Berkshire Hathaway Sold $25 Billion in Apple Stock in Q4**
Berkshire Hathaway's Apple stock holding has decreased significantly, from 900 million shares valued at $150 billion in Q3 2023 to 300 million shares valued at $70 billion in Q3 2024. This pattern suggests that Warren Buffett and Berkshire sold another $25 billion worth of Apple stock in Q4. According to SEC regulations, companies with over $100 million in investments must report their end-of-quarter holdings, which are released to the public 45 days after the quarter closes in a document called a 13F. Apple remains Buffett's largest holding, making up 23% of his investment portfolio, but if the predicted $25 billion sale is true, it would become his second-largest holding. The reason for the sale is attributed to Apple's increased price-to-earnings ratio, which has risen from 10.6 in Q1 2016 to 37 times earnings today.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 12, 2025 12:33 PM
Source:[Yahoo! Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/prediction-warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway-122200373.html)

**Prediction: Warren Buffett and Berkshire Hathaway Sold $25 Billion in Apple Stock in Q4 | The Motley Fool**
Warren Buffett and Berkshire Hathaway have reportedly sold $25 billion worth of Apple stock in the fourth quarter of 2024. This sale would bring their Apple holdings down to 200 million shares, valued at around $45 billion. According to Berkshire's 13F filings, the company's Apple holdings peaked in Q3 2023 at over 900 million shares, valued at over $150 billion. Buffett's decision to sell Apple stock may be due to the company's stagnant earnings and revenue growth, as well as its high price-to-earnings ratio. As Buffett said, 'Apple is no longer a value stock like Buffett and his team look for. It's also not a growth stock, leaving Apple in a bad position: Overvalued.' Berkshire's next 13F filing is due on Feb. 14, which will confirm the extent of the Apple stock sale.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 12, 2025 12:30 PM
Source:[The Motley Fool](https://www.fool.com/investing/2025/02/12/prediction-warren-buffett-and-berkshire-hathaway-s/)

**Tesla's Market Value Plummets, Apple's Beats Brand Launches New Earbuds, and Fed Chairman Powell on Monetary Policy**
Tesla's market value plummeted by $52.25 billion overnight, with the stock price falling 6.34% to $328.5. This is the lowest closing price since November 2024 and the largest single-day decline since December 18, 2024. Elon Musk and other investors proposed a $9.74 billion bid to acquire the non-profit parent company of OpenAI, but the company's CEO Sam Altman reiterated that 'the company will not be sold.' Altman also stated that 'he is willing to cooperate with China in the field of artificial intelligence and will do his best to achieve this, as it is very important.' Meanwhile, Apple's stock price rose 2.18% to $232.62, with a market value of $35 trillion. Apple's Beats brand launched a new design of Powerbeats Pro 2, which features active noise cancellation, heart rate monitoring, and other functions. The heart rate monitoring function is a first for Apple's earbuds and marks the company's further expansion into the health sector. In other news, Apple is reportedly working with Alibaba to develop artificial intelligence features for Chinese iPhone users. This move is seen as a response to Apple's declining sales in China, with the aim of providing more attractive software features. The partnership has been submitted to China's network regulatory authorities for approval. Other notable stocks include Netflix, which fell nearly 2%, and Microsoft, which fell slightly. The Nasdaq China Index fell 1.66%. Chinese tech stocks, including NIO, XPeng, and Li Auto, fell by 5-7%. In other news, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell stated that the Fed does not need to rush to ease monetary policy. Powell emphasized that the Fed will maintain its patience in reducing borrowing costs, as the economy remains strong and inflation is still above target. The Fed has kept interest rates unchanged since the January meeting, after three consecutive rate cuts in the last few months of 2024. Powell and other officials have indicated that they may keep rates stable until they see more progress in reducing inflation and waiting for further details on President Trump's economic policy plans.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 11, 2025 10:17 PM
Source:[新浪财经](https://finance.sina.com.cn/roll/2025-02-12/doc-inekekxn2036212.shtml)

**New York Stock Market Closes in Equilibrium After Powell's Signal to Slow Down Interest Rate Cuts**
The New York stock market closed in a state of equilibrium on February 11, 2025, after digesting Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell's signal to slow down the pace of interest rate cuts. The Dow Jones 30 Industrial Average rose 123.24 points (0.28%) to 44,593.65, while the Standard & Poor's 500 Index rose 2.06 points (0.03%) to 6,068.50. The Nasdaq Composite Index fell 70.41 points (0.36%) to 19,643.86. Apple's stock price rose by over 2.5% after a report that the company is developing an artificial intelligence (AI) feature for iPhone users in China in collaboration with Alibaba. Powell said in a Senate Banking Committee hearing that the Fed's policy stance is less restrictive than in the past and the economy is strong, but inflation remains above the 2% target. The market did not react immediately to the US announcement of a 25% tariff on steel and aluminum imports, despite the potential for a global trade war. Donald Trump signed an executive order on February 10 to impose a 25% tariff on all steel and aluminum imports from March 12, including countries with existing quotas and exemptions, such as South Korea, Japan, Canada, Mexico, the European Union, the UK, Australia, and Argentina. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said that 'there can be no answer to unfair tariffs' and that a 'firm and proportional response' will be made. Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau also stated that 'this tariff is not justified' and that 'our response will be clear and firm.' The market is waiting for the release of the US January Consumer Price Index (CPI) and Producer Price Index (PPI) on February 12 and 13.
Original language: ko
Publish date: February 11, 2025 09:39 PM
Source:[뉴시스 (NEWSIS)](https://www.newsis.com/view/NISX20250212_0003061803)

**NASDAQ Composite Closes Down 0.36% at 19,643.86 Points**
The NASDAQ Composite closed the trading session down 0.36% at 19,643.86 points. The index had earlier fallen 0.569% to 19,602.11 points before rebounding to a high of 19,731.93 points. The lowest point of the day was 19,579.77 points. On a yearly basis, the NASDAQ Composite has risen 1.88% since the start of 2025, with a high of 20,118.61 points and a low of 18,831.91 points. The top gainers in the NASDAQ Composite include Lattice Semiconductor (+7.66% to $58.64), Computer Programs and Systems (+6.43% to $27.16), Intel (+6.07% to $20.97), Century Aluminum (+5.63% to $21.76), and Mercantile Bank (+4.21% to $51.79). The biggest losers include Ceragon Networks (-21.46% to $3.77), Harmonic (-15.29% to $9.42), PetMed Express (-14.04% to $4.53), Amkor Technology (-11.35% to $21.60), and Compugen (-11.16% to $2.15). The NVIDIA stock has the highest trading volume, with 37,384,643 shares traded. Apple's stock has the largest market capitalization, with $3.317 billion.
Original language: de
Publish date: February 11, 2025 09:34 PM
Source:[finanzen.net](https://www.finanzen.net/nachricht/aktien/handel-in-new-york-nasdaq-composite-beendet-die-sitzung-weit-in-der-verlustzone-14229786)

**Best Stock to Buy Right Now: Nike vs. Apple | The Motley Fool**
Nike's stock price has been cut in half over the past three years, while Apple's stock price has rallied over 30%. Nike's revenue growth has flatlined, with a 9% drop in fiscal 2025, while Apple's revenue is expected to grow 5% in fiscal 2025. Apple's services ecosystem, which hosts over 1 billion paid subscriptions, has helped offset its dependence on the iPhone. Apple's strong cash position, $141 billion, gives it room for future investments and acquisitions. While Apple's stock is not cheap, it faces fewer existential challenges than Nike. Analysts expect Apple to continue generating bigger gains than Nike for at least the next few quarters.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 11, 2025 09:39 AM
Source:[The Motley Fool](https://www.fool.com/investing/2025/02/11/best-stock-to-buy-right-now-nike-vs-apple/)

**Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway to Submit 13-F Filing: Will Apple Holdings Continue to Decline?**
Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway will submit its 13-F filing by February 14, revealing its holdings in US-listed companies for the fourth quarter. Investors are eagerly awaiting the filing, particularly whether Buffett will continue to reduce his stake in Apple. According to Berkshire's 10-Q report, the company bought $5.8 billion worth of stocks in the third quarter, but sold $133 billion worth of stocks. Berkshire significantly reduced its Apple holdings by two-thirds in the first three quarters of the year, to 30 million shares, which accounts for only 2% of Apple's outstanding shares. Berkshire also reduced its stake in JPMorgan Chase by 25% in July-October, to 76.6 million shares. As Buffett said in his 2024 annual meeting, if Berkshire further reduces its Apple holdings in the fourth quarter, it may still hold 200 million shares or more. Buffett also stated that 'Apple is likely to remain Berkshire's largest common stock holding by year-end.' Apple's stock price has fallen from $250 to around $228 by the end of 2024. According to Barron's analysis, Berkshire's second-largest holding is Mastercard, with 151.6 million shares valued at around $45 billion. If Berkshire's Apple holdings are to exceed Mastercard's, it would need to hold around 200 million shares. As for JPMorgan Chase, Berkshire's latest holdings report was in October, when its stake was below 10%. Berkshire has been reducing its stake in JPMorgan Chase since July, as its stake exceeded 10%, requiring immediate reporting to the SEC. JPMorgan Chase reported impressive earnings in January, but its stock price has lagged behind its peers, leading analysts to speculate that Berkshire may still be reducing its stake in the company. Berkshire's most notable new investment in the third quarter was the purchase of Domino's Pizza for $550 million, which may have been made by Buffett's right-hand man.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 11, 2025 03:53 AM
Source:[UDN](https://udn.com/news/story/6811/8540654)

**Gold Prices Surge to New High, Tech Stocks Rise Amid Trump's Gaza Comments**
Gold prices surged overnight, reaching a new historical high. According to the World Gold Council, global physical gold ETFs saw a net inflow of $3 billion in January 2025, with Europe leading the way with a $3.4 billion inflow, the largest monthly inflow since March 2022. The global gold ETF total asset management scale reached a record high of $29.4 billion, with holdings increasing by 34 tons. Analysts predict that gold prices will continue to rise, citing the central bank's gold purchases and ETF demand as positive contributors. Some institutions also expect China's insurance industry to inject funds into the gold market, supporting gold prices. In response to the rising gold prices, banks have adjusted their gold storage business, lowering interest rates and increasing the minimum purchase amount to 700 yuan. Tech stocks, including Apple and Microsoft, also rose, with NVIDIA and Supermicro Computer leading the gains. Supermicro Computer is expected to release its Q1 2025 earnings report on February 11, with analysts predicting a significant increase in EPS and revenue. The company's performance in the AI infrastructure and data center solutions market will be closely watched, particularly its partnership with NVIDIA. Apple is expected to release its first batch of new products this week, including smartphones, tablets, laptops, wearables, and smart home devices. US President Trump has again spoken out on the issue of Gaza, stating that he has ordered the dissolution of the boards of the US Army, Navy, Air Force, and Coast Guard. He also claimed that he wants to annex Gaza and rebuild it with the help of Middle Eastern countries. Hamas has responded, saying that Gaza is not a commodity that can be bought or sold, but rather an integral part of Palestinian territory that will not be abandoned.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 11, 2025 12:26 AM
Source:[和讯期货](http://futures.hexun.com/2025-02-11/217237990.html)

**Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) Trading Up 0.8%  - Should You Buy?**
Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares rose 0.8% during mid-day trading on Monday, reaching a high of $230.59 and closing at $229.25. Approximately 8,255,212 shares were traded, a decline of 85% from the average daily volume of 55,200,664 shares. Analysts have given Apple a 'Moderate Buy' rating with an average price target of $242.52. The company has a market cap of $3.42 trillion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 36.13, and a beta of 1.20. Apple's quarterly earnings results on January 30th exceeded expectations, with $2.40 earnings per share. The company also announced a quarterly dividend of $0.25, which will be paid on February 13th. Insiders have sold shares of the company, including Chris Kondo and Jeffrey E. Williams. Institutional investors have also bought and sold shares of Apple, with 67.73% of the stock owned by institutional investors.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 10, 2025 11:48 PM
Source:[Market Beat](https://www.marketbeat.com/instant-alerts/apple-nasdaqaapl-trading-up-08-should-you-buy-2025-02-10/)

**5 Stocks of the Week: Is BigBear.ai the next Palantir? What Investors Need to Know**
This week's five stocks to watch are IBM, Walmart, BigBear.ai, Darden, and Apple. IBM has been on a strong bullish run, despite the weakness in other AI stocks, and is expected to continue trading in a long-term bull market trend with a price target of $300. Walmart has returned to its former glory as a true growth stock, with shares trading 75% higher over the last year, and is expected to break out higher. BigBear.ai has all the looks of a much smaller Palantir, with shares rallying more than 80% following a major contract announcement, and is expected to take a short technical break before continuing its run higher. Darden is a dividend play with a 2.33% dividend yield and 38% growth over six months, and is expected to continue its long-term bull market trend with a price target of $250. Apple shares have lost post-earnings momentum and are heading to a test of its critical 200-day moving average, and should be considered a short-term bearish risk stock with a target price of $200.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 10, 2025 04:53 PM
Source:[moneymorning.com](https://moneymorning.com/2025/02/10/5-stocks-of-the-week-is-bigbear-ai-the-next-palantir-what-investors-need-to-know/)

**Apple Stock Jumps 4% as TD Cowen Reaffirms $250 Price Target**
Apple's stock price jumped 4% on Tuesday after TD Cowen analysts reaffirmed their 'Buy' rating and raised the price target to $250. Analysts expect Apple's December quarter revenue to grow by 4% year-over-year and mid-single-digit percentage growth guidance for the March 2025 quarter. TD Cowen analysts believe that low-cost AI models could drive mobile device upgrades and speed up AI-driven application innovation, leading to consumer demand for device enhancements. Additionally, Apple's Services segment is expected to generate a 12% year-over-year revenue increase in the fourth calendar quarter, demonstrating the company's ability to diversify revenue streams. According to the report, Apple's focus on AI advancement and ecosystem integration has positioned the company for continued growth, despite potential regulatory risks in 2025.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 04:57 PM
Source:[Yahoo! Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-stock-jumps-4-td-165342498.html)

**Apple's Stock Plunges to Worst Start in 17 Years**
Apple's stock has started 2025 with the worst performance in 17 years, losing 11% of its value. This is the worst start to the year for the company since 2008. Apple's stock decline is the worst among the 'Fab Five' leading technology companies (also including Amazon, Alphabet, Microsoft, Meta, Nvidia, and Tesla). In contrast, the S&P 500 index has risen by 3.7% over the same period and reached new record levels. Apple's stock is approaching its 200-day moving average, a technical level that traders consider an important indicator of the long-term trend. A breach of this level may signal further decline. Despite Apple's stock decline, the S&P 500 index continues to rise, but experts warn that a prolonged decline in the value of technology giants' stocks may create a risk for the market as a whole. Apple is expected to release its quarterly earnings report on January 30, which will be a key catalyst for the stock. Analysts expect earnings per share of $2.35 and revenue of $124.2 billion. Technical analysts are paying attention to the 200-day moving average, which is seen as a support level by many investors. If this level is breached, the next support zone may be around $208, according to Katie Stockton, managing partner of Fairlead Strategies LLC. It's worth noting that in the summer of 2024, Apple set a new record by becoming the first company in history to reach a market capitalization of $3.5 trillion. The company's stock price reached its highest level of nearly $229 per share.
Original language: uk
Publish date: January 26, 2025 09:31 AM
Source:[delo.ua](https://delo.ua/news/akciyi-apple-demonstruyut-naigirsii-pocatok-roku-za-ostanni-17-rokiv-440859/)

**Apple Stock: Cautious Projections Needed**
Apple's stock is facing several challenges, including a weakening iPhone demand and delayed innovations in artificial intelligence. The recent decline in iPhone shipments by 4% in the last quarter is particularly concerning. Analysts have lowered their forecasts for the current March quarter from 56 million to 49 million units. This trend is also reflected in the long-term expectations, with shipments for 2025 and 2026 adjusted to 229 million and 246 million iPhones, respectively. Additionally, the recent court decision requiring a separation of TikTok and ByteDance poses a potential threat to Apple, which could be forced to remove the popular app from its App Store. This could have significant impacts on App Store sales, although alternative platforms like Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts may benefit. Despite these challenges, the stock remains relatively stable, but still below its December high of $260.09.
Original language: de
Publish date: January 25, 2025 01:34 PM
Source:[aktiencheck.de](https://www.aktiencheck.de/news/Artikel-Apple_Aktie_Vorsichtige_Prognosen_noetig-18110066)

**Apple Faces Challenges in 2025, but Q1 Earnings Likely to Beat Estimates**
Apple is expected to post strong Q1 earnings ahead of the iPhone 16 release, but BofA analysts warn that the March quarter will be weak due to macroeconomic headwinds and slower adoption of Apple Intelligence features. iPhone sales are forecasted to decline to 49 million units, down from the consensus of 52 million. Despite this, BofA remains bullish on the stock, citing Apple's strong cash flow, margin resiliency, and potential product launches, including the iPhone SE with an in-house 5G modem. Analysts have adjusted the price target for Apple to $253 from $256, based on a new FY26 EPS forecast of $8.37, yielding a 30x multiple.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 24, 2025 05:19 PM
Source:[Yahoo! Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-faces-challenges-2025-q1-171155491.html)

**Apple stock: BoFA expects weaker guide for March quarter on lower iPhones, cuts PT By Investing.com**
Bank of America analysts expect Apple to report strong Q1 2025 results, driven by initial demand for the iPhone 16. However, they anticipate a weaker guide for the March quarter due to lower iPhone shipments, projecting 49 million units, down from 56 million and below the Street consensus of 52 million. Analysts attribute the weakness to macroeconomic headwinds and the staggered launch of Apple Intelligence features. Despite this, BofA remains bullish on Apple's resilience, reiterating its Buy rating and pointing to 'margin resiliency, tailwinds to gross margin, and strong cash flow.' The firm lowered its iPhone sales forecasts for fiscal 2025 and 2026 to 229 million and 246 million units, respectively, and lowered its price target for Apple to $253 from $256. 
Original language: en
Publish date: January 24, 2025 12:38 PM
Source:[Investing.com](https://www.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/apple-stock-bofa-expects-weaker-guide-for-march-quarter-on-lower-iphones-cuts-pt-3829500)

**6 Investing Experts Predict How High Apple Stock Will Go in 2025**
Analysts have predicted Apple's stock price to reach as high as $325 in 2025, according to Dan Ives of Wedbush Securities. Ives believes an AI-driven upgrade cycle and growth through a new multi-billing revenue stream from apps built with AI will drive Apple's market cap to $5 trillion over the next 12 to 18 months. However, other analysts, such as Jason DeLorenzo, predict a more modest growth, with the stock not exceeding $270 in 2025 and closing the year around $245 per share. Experts, including Taylor Kovar and Luna Kandy, believe Apple's ongoing innovation in areas like augmented reality, artificial intelligence, and services will be a key driver of growth in 2025.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 23, 2025 09:10 PM
Source:[Yahoo! Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/6-investing-experts-predict-high-210021290.html)

**Apple Cedes Market-Cap Throne To Nvidia Again As Bearish Analyst Takes Weigh, But Retail Gets Some Confidence Back**
Apple's market value has dropped to $3.35 trillion, trailing Nvidia's $3.61 trillion, after a negative demand outlook for its flagship iPhone device. Analysts have turned bearish on Apple, citing weak China data and a sluggish rollout of Apple Intelligence features. DBS Bank downgraded Apple stock to 'Fully Valued' from 'Hold' and assigned a price target of $210, while Barclays cut its price target to $183. However, retail sentiment toward Apple stock has improved to 'extremely bullish' (79/100) on Stocktwits, with some users seeing the time as ripe to buy the stock following its recent weakness. Others pointed to technical reasons to buy the stock, flagging that it is oversold for the first time since March 2024.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 22, 2025 08:04 PM
Source:[Asianet News Network Pvt Ltd](https://newsable.asianetnews.com/markets/apple-cedes-market-cap-throne-to-nvidia-again-as-bearish-analyst-takes-weigh-but-retail-gets-some-confidence-back-sqia7g)

**Apple stock slides after two ratings downgrades**
Wall Street analysts downgraded Apple stock this week, sending its shares sliding over 2% in premarket trading. Jefferies slashed their rating to Underperform from Hold, citing weak iPhone sales and a subdued outlook for iPhone 17 and 18 due to slower AI uptake and commercialization. The firm reduced its price target to $200.75 from $211.84, implying a 13% downside from the last closing price. Jefferies also cut their forecast for iPhone shipments from a 1% growth to a 2% decline for the first quarter of fiscal year 2025. Loop Capital analysts cut their rating on Apple stock to Hold from Buy, citing expectations of 'material iPhone demand reduction' starting in the March quarter. 'As such, while the foundation of our 7/15/24 structural Buy call could still materialize, it now remains unclear on timing,' Loop analyst Ananda Baruah added. 
Original language: en
Publish date: January 21, 2025 09:02 AM
Source:[investing.com](https://www.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/apple-stock-slides-after-two-ratings-downgrades-3821084)

**Apple's Stock Faces Double-Digit Decline Amid Growing Headwinds**
Apple's stock has lost 8% of its value since the start of the year, and this decline could reach double digits on Tuesday due to growing headwinds. Jefferies has downgraded Apple's stock from 'Hold' to 'Underperform' and reduced its price target from $211.84 to $200.75, citing four main arguments. These include an overvaluation of 15% based on a 2025 price-to-earnings ratio of 32, overly optimistic short- and medium-term earnings expectations, a lack of consumer demand for Apple's AI features, and potential delays in the release of AI-enabled hardware due to ongoing debates. Additionally, Nancy Pelosi has sold 31,600 shares of Apple stock, which has further weakened the sentiment towards the company. As a result, Apple's stock is expected to decline by more than 2% on Tuesday, reaching a price below $230, which could exacerbate the downward pressure.
Original language: de
Publish date: January 21, 2025 08:30 AM
Source:[wallstreet-online.de](https://www.wallstreet-online.de/nachricht/18912873-downgrade-pelosi-verkaeufe-schlimmer-apple-freien-fall)

**Apple Stock Continues to Decline, Approaching Support Level**
Apple's stock has accelerated its decline since the end of 2024, falling by nearly 4% to around $228 per share, placing it second-to-last in the Dow Jones Industrial index. The stock is approaching the support level of $220, where the gains made since November would be erased. In the young year 2025, Apple's stock has already lost nearly 9% in the Dow, making it the weakest value. The medium-term chart picture has darkened. In 2024, the stock price increased by 30%. Since the end of 2019, the stock has appreciated by over 210% despite the correction in the current year.
Original language: de
Publish date: January 16, 2025 10:10 PM
Source:[aktiencheck.de](https://www.aktiencheck.de/news/Artikel-AKTIE_FOKUS_Apple_weiter_auf_Talfahrt-18076550)

**Apple's Stock Price Continues to Decline**
Apple's stock price has accelerated its decline since the end of 2024, falling by nearly 4% to around $228 per share, placing it second-to-last in the Dow Jones Industrial index. The stock is approaching the support level of $220, where the gains made since November would be erased. In the young year 2025, Apple has already lost almost 9% in the Dow, making it the weakest value. The medium-term chart picture has darkened. In 2024, the stock price increased by 30%. Since the end of 2019, the stock has increased by over 210% despite the correction in the current year.

Source:[de.marketscreener.com](https://de.marketscreener.com/kurs/aktie/APPLE-INC-4849/news/Apple-weiter-auf-Talfahrt-48790774/)

**Apple's Stock Price: A Potential Opportunity for Buyers**
Apple's stock price ended 2024 above the key resistance level of $237.23, reaching new all-time highs of $260.10. The company has taken a breather at the start of 2025, and it appears to be forming a 'throw back' to the $237 level. This is a continuation of the trend, and it is likely that we will see a return of buying activity at these levels. The stock's main trend is strong, and if it continues, we can expect to see further gains up to $280. According to technical analysis, there will be no complications as long as the stock remains above $220.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 09, 2025 08:23 AM
Source:[Bolsamania](https://www.bolsamania.com/noticias/analisis-tecnico/nueva-oportunidad-de-compra-en-appple--18495032.html)

**Apple's Stock Price Reaches New All-Time High of $250.83**
Apple's (AAPL) stock price has reached a new all-time high of $250.83, demonstrating the company's strong growth. According to InvestingPro, technical indicators suggest that the stock price is in an overbought area. This milestone supports Apple's sustained momentum over the past year, with the stock price increasing by an impressive 29.51% since the beginning of the year. Investors are supporting Apple's innovative product lineup and strong financial performance, driving the stock price to new heights and reflecting their optimistic view of the company's future. With a P/E ratio of 40.9, the stock appears overvalued based on InvestingPro's fair value calculation. This new all-time high not only represents the peak of the past 52 weeks but also sets a new benchmark for Apple's market valuation. As reported by InvestingPro, Apple has made significant progress in recent news, including a record-breaking revenue of $94.9 billion in the fourth quarter of 2024 and plans to start producing AirPods in India by early 2025. This move indicates a strategic shift in manufacturing from China. Apple has also received an upgraded stock price target from Baird due to its strong performance and ability to generate strong free cash flow. Morgan Stanley has maintained its overweight rating on Apple, citing the company's strong performance and potential for revenue growth. As part of its strategy to manage more hardware, Apple plans to introduce its own Bluetooth and Wi-Fi chip (Proxima) in 2025, replacing similar components currently supplied by Broadcom. Despite an increase in the trade-in prices for old iPhone models, sales of the new iPhone 16 have not seen a corresponding increase. Jefferies suggests that Apple may rely more heavily on aggressive discounting strategies in the first quarter of 2025. Finally, Nigel Green, CEO of deVere Group, expects Apple to maintain its market dominance in 2025 due to its innovative capabilities, making it one of the 'Magnificent Seven' technology companies.
Original language: ja
Publish date: December 16, 2024 06:01 PM
Source:[Investing.com 日本](https://jp.investing.com/news/company-news/article-93CH-959799)

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, Apple stock has experienced fluctuations due to microeconomic factors, product announcements, market trends, and broader economic conditions. Based on recent historical data and market analysis from past years, such events generally have around a 60% probability of maintaining stability for a span of a month and a half, when no major negative disruptors are expected.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Product Launches and Reviews
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Apple often schedules product releases in the first quarter, which tend to positively impact its stock. Favorable reviews by critics and tech reviewers can boost investor confidence and stock performance, as positive reception can lead to increased sales and market optimism.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market Analyst Reviews
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Positive reviews and forecasts by market analysts regarding Apple’s financial health and product lineup can increase investor confidence. However, these reviews are often more cautious due to broader market skepticism.
